content:
InputGestureCollection Class

In this Article

Represents an ordered collection of InputGesture objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class InputGestureCollection : System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • InputGestureCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Constructors summary

InputGestureCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the InputGestureCollection class.
InputGestureCollection(IList)

Initializes a new instance of the InputGestureCollection class using the elements in the specified IList.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of InputGesture items in this InputGestureCollection.
IsFixedSize

Gets a value that indicates whether this InputGestureCollection has a fixed size.
IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether this InputGestureCollection is read-only. The default value is false.
IsSynchronized

Gets a value that indicates whether this InputGestureCollection is synchronized (thread safe).
Item(Int32)

Gets or set the InputGesture at the specified index.
SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to this InputGestureCollection.

Methods summary

Add(InputGesture)

Adds the specified InputGesture to this InputGestureCollection.
AddRange(ICollection)

Adds the elements of the specified ICollection to the end of this InputGestureCollection.
Clear()

Removes all elements from the InputGestureCollection.
Contains(InputGesture)

Determines whether the specified InputGesture is in the collection.
CopyTo(InputGesture[],Int32)

Copies all of the items in the InputGestureCollection to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
GetEnumerator()

Gets an enumerator that iterates through this InputGestureCollection.
IndexOf(InputGesture)

Searches for the first occurrence of the specified InputGesture in this InputGestureCollection.
Insert(Int32,InputGesture)

Inserts the specified InputGesture into this InputGestureCollection at the specified index.
Remove(InputGesture)

Removes the first occurrence of the specified InputGesture from this InputGestureCollection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the specified InputGesture at the specified index of this InputGestureCollection.
Seal()

Sets this InputGestureCollection to read-only.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*.

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Add*.

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Contains*.
IList.IndexOf(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IndexOf*.
IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Insert*.
IList.Item(Int32)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Item*.
IList.Remove(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Remove*.

Constructors

  • InputGestureCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the InputGestureCollection class.

    public InputGestureCollection ();
  • InputGestureCollection(IList)

    Initializes a new instance of the InputGestureCollection class using the elements in the specified IList.

    public InputGestureCollection (System.Collections.IList inputGestures);

    Parameters

    • inputGestures
      IList

      The collection whose elements are copied to the new InputGestureCollection.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of InputGesture items in this InputGestureCollection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of gestures in the collection.

  • IsFixedSize

    Gets a value that indicates whether this InputGestureCollection has a fixed size.

    public bool IsFixedSize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection has a fixed size; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    If the collection is read-only, IsFixedSize is true.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets a value that indicates whether this InputGestureCollection is read-only. The default value is false.

    public bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection read-only; otherwise, false.

  • IsSynchronized

    Gets a value that indicates whether this InputGestureCollection is synchronized (thread safe).

    public bool IsSynchronized { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection is thread-safe; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    SyncRoot can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or set the InputGesture at the specified index.

    public System.Windows.Input.InputGesture this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The position in the collection.

    Property Value

    • InputGesture

      The gesture at the specified index.

  • SyncRoot

    Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to this InputGestureCollection.

    public object SyncRoot { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Methods

  • Add(InputGesture)

    Adds the specified InputGesture to this InputGestureCollection.

    public int Add (System.Windows.Input.InputGesture inputGesture);

    Parameters

    • inputGesture
      InputGesture

      The gesture to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      0, if the operation was successful (note that this is not the index of the added item).

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      the collection is read-only.

    • ArgumentNullException

      the gesture is null.

    Example

    The following example creates a KeyGesture and adds it to the InputGestureCollection of a RoutedCommand. 

    <Window.InputBindings>
  <KeyBinding Key="B"
              Modifiers="Control" 
              Command="ApplicationCommands.Open" />
</Window.InputBindings>

    KeyGesture OpenCmdKeyGesture = new KeyGesture(
    Key.B,
    ModifierKeys.Control);

ApplicationCommands.Open.InputGestures.Add(OpenCmdKeyGesture);

    Dim OpenCmdKeyGesture As New KeyGesture(Key.B, ModifierKeys.Control)

ApplicationCommands.Open.InputGestures.Add(OpenCmdKeyGesture)
  • AddRange(ICollection)

    Adds the elements of the specified ICollection to the end of this InputGestureCollection.

    public void AddRange (System.Collections.ICollection collection);

    Parameters

    • collection
      ICollection

      The collection of items to add to the end of this InputGestureCollection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      The collection is read-only.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The collection to add is null.

  • Clear()

    Removes all elements from the InputGestureCollection.

    public void Clear ();

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      The collection is read only.

  • Contains(InputGesture)

    Determines whether the specified InputGesture is in the collection.

    public bool Contains (System.Windows.Input.InputGesture key);

    Parameters

    • key
      InputGesture

      The gesture to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the gesture is in the collection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(InputGesture[],Int32)

    Copies all of the items in the InputGestureCollection to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

    public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Input.InputGesture[] inputGestures, int index);

    Parameters

    • inputGestures
      InputGesture[]

      An array into which the collection is copied.

    • index
      Int32

      The index position in the inputGestures at which copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      inputGestures is a null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than 0.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Gets an enumerator that iterates through this InputGestureCollection.

    public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      The enumerator for this collection.

  • IndexOf(InputGesture)

    Searches for the first occurrence of the specified InputGesture in this InputGestureCollection.

    public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Input.InputGesture value);

    Parameters

    • value
      InputGesture

      The gesture to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the first occurrence of value, if found; otherwise, -1.

  • Insert(Int32,InputGesture)

    Inserts the specified InputGesture into this InputGestureCollection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Input.InputGesture inputGesture);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      Index at which to insert inputGesture.

    • inputGesture
      InputGesture

      The gesture to insert.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      inputGesture is null.

  • Remove(InputGesture)

    Removes the first occurrence of the specified InputGesture from this InputGestureCollection.

    public void Remove (System.Windows.Input.InputGesture inputGesture);

    Parameters

    • inputGesture
      InputGesture

      The gesture to remove.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      The collection is read-only.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The gesture is null.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes the specified InputGesture at the specified index of this InputGestureCollection.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the gesture to remove.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than 0.

  • Seal()

    Sets this InputGestureCollection to read-only.

    public void Seal ();

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*.

    void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      A zero-based Array that receives the copied items from the InputGestureCollection.

    • index
      Int32

      The first position in the specified Array to receive the copied contents.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

  • IList.Add(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Add*.

    int IList.Add (object inputGesture);

    Parameters

    • inputGesture
      System.Object

      The Object to add to the InputGestureCollection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The position into which the new element was inserted.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Contains(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Contains*.

    bool IList.Contains (object key);

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      The Object to locate in the TextEffectCollection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the Object is found in the InputGestureCollection; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.IndexOf(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IndexOf*.

    int IList.IndexOf (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      The Object to locate in the InputGestureCollection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Insert*.

    void IList.Insert (int index, object value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which to insert the Object.

    • value
      System.Object

      The Object to insert into the InputGestureCollection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Item(Int32)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Item*.

    object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the element to get or set.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The element at the specified index.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Remove(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Remove*.

    void IList.Remove (object inputGesture);

    Parameters

    • inputGesture
      System.Object

      The Object to remove from the InputGestureCollection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputGestureCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.
